sentence.Network_en: She has made outspoken remarks about the legalisation of cannabis in Britain.
sentence.Network_cn: 她对英国关于大麻的立法进行了大胆评论。

sentence.Network_en: He became an outspoken opponent of the old Soviet system.
sentence.Network_cn: 他成为旧的苏联体制直言不讳的抨击者。

sentence.Network_en: Far from lying low, Kuti became more outspoken than ever.
sentence.Network_cn: 库蒂不但没暂避风头，而且较以往更加直言不讳。

that the government would target a tv dating series is not unusual ; beijing has long been wary of china' s increasingly freewheeling reality programs and the outspoken stars they produce .国家把矛头指向社交节目并不少见；北京政府对日益增长的那些随心所欲的真人秀和这些节目所产出的那些从不客气的明星慎之又慎。

entry.def: Someone who is outspoken gives their opinions about things openly and honestly, even if they are likely to shock or offend people.

example.ex: Some church leaders have been outspoken in their support for political reform in Kenya...
example.tran: 一些教会领袖明确表示支持肯尼亚的政治改革。

example.ex: He was an outspoken critic of apartheid.
example.tran: 他公开抨击种族隔离制度。

means.word_mean: 1. given to expressing yourself freely or insistently;
2. characterized by directness in manner or speech; without subtlety or evasion;

sentences.sentence: "tell me what you think--and you may just as well be frank"
"it is possible to be outspoken without being rude"

auth_sentence.content: He is an outspoken, populist, well-known guy.

auth_sentence.content: He is known as an outspoken critic of Israel.

sentences.en: She is an outspoken critic of the school system in this city.
sentences.cn: 她是这座城市里学校制度的坦率的批评者。
